title: Unfair Perma Ban
body: I have only been banned once before the perma ban and literally all thats in the chat logs was me calling someone a fa**ot, and thats it, i even like apologized and told them to have a good night. Only banned once and was actively trying to improve the toxicity in general by muting people and get perma banned. Even with over 250+ skins on the account. This is completely unjust and absolute BS please someone help me get this unbanned.

replies.body: Hate speech is zero-tolerance. Sorry, unfortunately you won't be getting that account back.

You were explicitly warned when you were banned prior that **any** further negativity or rule violations would result in a permanent ban.

You proceeded to use hate speech. And you're surprised?

Hey! Dont bother getting second hand information! Go straight to the source! Look up the summoners code, take a read at the rules, and compare it to your chat log. You will find for yourself what rules you broke! If you find any rules broken, obviously the ban was fair!

> [{quoted}](name=Telephone Booth,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=TqBM2yHd,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-12-14T06:08:42.289+0000)
>
> Hey! Dont bother getting second hand information! Go straight to the source! Look up the summoners code, take a read at the rules, and compare it to your chat log. You will find for yourself what rules you broke! If you find any rules broken, obviously the ban was fair!

Violating rules and receiving a punishment doesn't automatically make some specific punishment fair or appropriate.

More than that, Summoner's Code doesn't specify that saying f%%%%t is something exceptional or that it should be/would be punished by a 2-week ban.

>Violating rules and receiving a punishment doesn't automatically make some specific punishment fair or appropriate.

Doesn't matter, they're called rules for a reason. They're not overly oppressive or imposing. All you have to do is not be an asshole and you will never get punished. 

The Summoner's Code talks about exemplary behavior and how to act in general, the Riot Support website goes more into detail about the specifics of punishments. He also said "Go straight to the source" and "Take a read (look) at the rules."

> [{quoted}](name=Hotarµ,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=TqBM2yHd,comment-id=000500000000,timestamp=2018-12-14T14:14:36.261+0000)
>
> Doesn't matter, they're called rules for a reason. They're not overly oppressive or imposing. All you have to do is not be an asshole and you will never get punished. 

Being an asshole is not defined.

> The Summoner's Code talks about exemplary behavior and how to act in general, the Riot Support website goes more into detail about the specifics of punishments. He also said "Go straight to the source" and "Take a read (look) at the rules."

Yeah, all of them are vague and inconclusive. On purpose.

All of it is *very* easy to understand and follow. Would you say it in a public area or workspace? No? Don't say it in League. Would you say it to a close friend? Maybe. But is that socially acceptable to most people? Probably not.

 Common sense goes a long way. 


#From Riot Support:

>WHY WAS I PUNISHED WHEN THE OTHER PERSON WAS WORSE OR STARTED IT!
>Simply speaking, retaliation is not an acceptable or justifiable behavior. An argument between two players can easily create a negative experience for the rest of the players in the game with you. Regardless of the other player’s actions, this does not justify your own behavior. You alone are responsible for your actions within the game.If you encounter a toxic player like this, the best option is to simply report their behavior and move on.

__________________

Also from Riot Support: 

>WHY DID I SKIP RESTRICTIONS?

>We have a zero-tolerance policy for extreme negative behavior as well as extremely offensive language and remarks made in game towards other players.

__________________

ALSO from Riot Support:

>PUNISHMENTS GENERALLY FOLLOW A BASIC ESCALATION PATH:

>First Offense: 10 Game Chat Restriction
>Second Offense: 25 Game Chat Restriction
>Third Offense: Two Week Suspension
>Fourth Offense: Permanent Suspension

>However, it is possible to skip to a Two Week or Permanent suspension based on the severity of the behavior in the game. Excessive negative behavior can result in a Two-Week or Permanent suspension at any time without having a chat restriction on the account.

> [{quoted}](name=Hotarµ,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=TqBM2yHd,comment-id=00050000000000000000,timestamp=2018-12-14T15:10:59.395+0000)
>
> All of it is *very* easy to understand and follow. Would you say it in a public area or workspace? No? Don't say it in League. Would you say it to a close friend? Maybe. But is that socially acceptable to most people? Probably not.

I am allowed to say "n%%%%r" and "f%%%%t" in public workspace as much as I like. In fact, I used both of them, discussing Riot's stupid policy with my colleague about 8 hours ago. It's socially acceptable down here. Probably yes.

>  Common sense goes a long way. 

But Riot lacks it.

> #From Riot Support:

Punishable retaliatory behaviour is not specified. The definition of "toxic" is not specified.

> Also from Riot Support: 
> WHY DID I SKIP RESTRICTIONS?
> 
> We have a zero-tolerance policy for extreme negative behavior as well as extremely offensive language and remarks made in game towards other players.

Said behaviour, language and sort of remarks are not specified. More than that, you get punished for them even if they are not made towards other players, which is omitted. What a coincidence.

> ALSO from Riot Support:

Yes, they specify that there are tiers and that they can be skipped. This information is unusable and, hilariously, you have to dig to find it. You have to be really motivated to learn about the punishment system. It's not anywhere in the client.

Yes, I'm supposed to believe you openly used racist and homophobic slurs in a common workplace with normal people. 

 Not going to argue anymore since this isn't the first discussion I've had with you. Reading comprehension and common sense are essential and you should be able to apply those to every day situations, more so to video games and their communities. 

 None of that was digging, either. I literally googled "Riot league rules" and it took me about 17 seconds. I wish that was an exaggeration.

> [{quoted}](name=Hotarµ,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=TqBM2yHd,comment-id=0005000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-12-15T00:50:41.437+0000)
>
> Yes, I'm supposed to believe you openly used racist and homophobic slurs in a common workplace with normal people. 

Yep. Because I did. I can do it again, because we don't have a definition of "slur" in our country.

>  Not going to argue anymore since this isn't the first discussion I've had with you. Reading comprehension and common sense are essential and you should be able to apply those to every day situations, more so to video games and their communities. 

Of course, because there is nothing to argue about. Your pointless denial and appealing to common sense won't change Riot's practices of disproportionate retribution, intentionally obfuscating their own rules and hiding evidence so false-positives can't be appealed.

>  None of that was digging, either. I literally googled "Riot league rules" and it took me about 17 seconds. I wish that was an exaggeration.

Dammit, I think I might be in trouble. Should go out there and Google "Blizzard WoW rules", "GGG Path of Exile rules", "Valve Dota 2 rules" and maybe even "CDPR Witcher rules" because this is what every sane human does before playing the game, right?

Lol oh it doesnt? Well fuck me then.

> [{quoted}](name=Telephone Booth,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=TqBM2yHd,comment-id=000500000001,timestamp=2018-12-15T03:49:42.191+0000)
>
> Lol oh it doesnt? Well fuck me then.

It doesn't. Nothing funny about it.

If you had received a 14-day ban previously, that is considered the final warning. After that even minor toxicity can result in a permaban. Also I think Riot has a zero-tolerance for homophobic slurs, such as the one you used.

> Even with over 250+ skins on the account

That doesn't matter, everyone is treated equally, not matter how much money they've used/how many skins they own.

Unfortunately even if you apologize to the player that you harassed, the Instant Feedback System (IFS) will still punish you regardless. It also takes a very long time for past digressions (Chat Restrictions & 14-Day Bans) to be forgiven completely, **assuming if it's even possible for past digressions to be wiped from one's record at all**.

If you truly believe that you shouldn't have been Banned from your account, you can always try talking to Player Support via Riot Support.
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us
Since it's due to Hate Speech (which is ZT) & you have already been punished on that account, I'm not sure if they can do much. However it never hurts to try either. 

Regardless of what actions you take, I wish you the best of luck.
byebye account, your a prime example for others of what happens when your mean.
